AD_Idle_Guard000.synopsis: AD options for Guard 000 - He's moving around and complaining about being bored if he has nobody to talk to. If Guard 003 and 002 are free he'll start a conversation but otherwise it falls back to this.

AD_DeathReact_Guard004.synopsis: Reaction AD to any other guard or Tusgront being killed - mostly to cover edge cases so players know that they'll be attacked on sight. (Only one will play, but all the guards need them incase the player wipes anywhere from 1 to all-bar-one out) - This guard is repeatedly failing to cast a spell normally, so figured I'd give him a bit of flavour.

AD_DeathReact_Tusgront.synopsis: Kill any of Tusgront's guards either in his view or outside of his view - Mainly here to either show players why they're under attack, or call attention to the fact that they'll attack on sight.

AD_Idle_Guard004.synopsis: AD options for Guard 004 - His sequence is failing to cast a spell > Read a book > Fail to cast a spell > Read book. Pretty straightforward, but will at least offer him a tiny bit of character.

AD_DoorOpenedPlayer_Tusgront.synopsis: Tusgront's AD's for the few states he can be in infront of the Guildhall. In particular most of these are just there to confirm when he's done/tried to do an action, but the "Stolen ring" one is also there to prompt players that he's going to turn hostile if they approach the door and get caught now - as it wouldn't be obvious otherwise.
AD_DoorOpenedPlayer_Tusgront.how_to_trigger: In order:- Steal Tusgront's Ring (without being spotted) after the conversation, but before he's in position to open the door (Short time window, might need turn based mode)- Discover the secret door via perception, then cast knock/lockpick it- Convince Tusgront to open the door for you, then just actually let him do it.

AD_GuardGossip.synopsis: AD chains between guards 000, 002 and 003. 000 is patrolling near to 003, while 002 is on the rooftop and shouts down to them.

AD_DeathReact_Guard001.synopsis: Reaction AD to any other guard or Tusgront being killed - mostly to cover edge cases so players know that they'll be attacked on sight. (Only one will play, but all the guards need them incase the player wipes anywhere from 1 to all-bar-one out)

AD_DoorOpenedSelf_Tusgront.synopsis: Tusgront's AD to the player after opening the door

AD_MugOnLeaving_Tusgront.synopsis: Fallback case - Tusgront tries to stop you leaving the Alleyway, but you're somehow unable to initiate dialog with him, this is just an AD for the same line he has about not letting you leave - but in AD form incase players are muted or such as they leave.
AD_MugOnLeaving_Tusgront.how_to_trigger: - Bully your way into the alleyway (but not the guildhall) with Tusgront- Leave the area, but be muted or silenced or such

AD_DeathReact_Guard003.synopsis: Reaction AD to any other guard or Tusgront being killed - mostly to cover edge cases so players know that they'll be attacked on sight. (Only one will play, but all the guards need them incase the player wipes anywhere from 1 to all-bar-one out)

AD_HostileTrespass_Tusgront.synopsis: Players have tried to get into the Guildhall a little too aggressively - Either ignoring warnings, or getting caught after bypassing the hidden door. They won't always have got a warning, so it will benefit from being a bit on-the-nose about why they're attacking.

AD_DeathReact_Guard000.synopsis: Reaction AD to any other guard or Tusgront being killed - mostly to cover edge cases so players know that they'll be attacked on sight. (Only one will play, but all the guards need them incase the player wipes anywhere from 1 to all-bar-one out)

AD_StoleRing_Tusgront.synopsis: Players have stolen Tusgront's ring. Plays mainly so players know that the alert level is raised so them being attacked on sight is much more obvious.

AD_TusgrontIdles.synopsis: Tusgront's idle AD's that he can use to just intersperse his movements with a bit of flavour.

AD_DeathReact_Guard002.synopsis: Reaction AD to any other guard or Tusgront being killed - mostly to cover edge cases so players know that they'll be attacked on sight. (Only one will play, but all the guards need them incase the player wipes anywhere from 1 to all-bar-one out)

AD_Idle_Guard000_0.speaker: Sledge Pettifeet
AD_Idle_Guard000_0.text: No one to threaten, no one to intimidate. Waste of a good alley.

AD_DeathReact_Guard004_0.speaker: Sparks Musgravel
AD_DeathReact_Guard004_0.text: Right. Can't say you weren't warned!
AD_DeathReact_Guard004_0.context: NodeContext: Finally losing patience - about to start combat.

AD_DeathReact_Guard004_1.speaker: Sparks Musgravel
AD_DeathReact_Guard004_1.text: Whoever's skulking - if you make me lose another damn spell, I'll club you instead. Aye?
AD_DeathReact_Guard004_1.context: NodeContext: Our sneaking is distracting this guard from spell practice - he is not pleased

AD_DeathReact_Tusgront_0.speaker: Tusgront
AD_DeathReact_Tusgront_0.text: Huh. Someone playing games. They're going to lose.
AD_DeathReact_Tusgront_0.context: NodeContext: Guarded, looking around for player who is hidden

AD_DeathReact_Tusgront_1.speaker: Tusgront
AD_DeathReact_Tusgront_1.text: Should've stayed hidden down in the muck, worm!

AD_Idle_Guard004_0.speaker: Sparks Musgravel
AD_Idle_Guard004_0.text: Splay the fingers like so, and... damn it! Why won't it cast?
AD_Idle_Guard004_0.context: NodeContext: Trying and failing to cast a spell

AD_Idle_Guard004_1.speaker: Sparks Musgravel
AD_Idle_Guard004_1.text: If those bloody elven mages would just write their bloody tomes in bloody Common...
AD_Idle_Guard004_1.context: NodeContext: Trying and failing to cast a spell

AD_Idle_Guard004_2.speaker: Sparks Musgravel
AD_Idle_Guard004_2.text: Maybe my fingers are just too sausage-y for me to be a mage.
AD_Idle_Guard004_2.context: NodeContext: Trying and failing to cast a spell. Despondent, to himself.

AD_Idle_Guard004_3.speaker: Sparks Musgravel
AD_Idle_Guard004_3.context: NodeContext: Trying and failing to cast a spell - flubbing the latin proncunciation of 'Timere' (a frost spell). Last EH! is just a cry of frustration.

AD_DoorOpenedPlayer_Tusgront_0.speaker: Tusgront
AD_DoorOpenedPlayer_Tusgront_0.text: Already open? Huh. In you go.
AD_DoorOpenedPlayer_Tusgront_0.context: InternalNodeContext: This is in theory possible by discovering the door and casting knock - so he wouldn't need to actually open it.NodeContext: Expecting to find heavily locked door still locked - but it was open. Momentary bafflement, then shrugging and bringing player in.

AD_GuardGossip_2.speaker: Terse Torvalt
AD_GuardGossip_2.text: Look at that cloud. Looks just like a hollyphant, that does.
AD_GuardGossip_2.context: NodeContext: Slightly louder, calling down from the roof

AD_GuardGossip_9.speaker: Sledge Pettifeet
AD_GuardGossip_9.text: You're supposed to be looking out for us, not the bloody skies.

AD_GuardGossip_15.speaker: Terse Torvalt
AD_GuardGossip_15.text: Not my fault. I've got an overactive imagination.
AD_GuardGossip_15.context: NodeContext: Slightly louder, calling down from the roof. 'overactive imagination' as though it might be a medical condition, explaining to simpletons

AD_GuardGossip_6.speaker: Skeeve Stabwell
AD_GuardGossip_6.text: Try and imagine doing your job properly, then.

AD_GuardGossip_7.speaker: Sledge Pettifeet
AD_GuardGossip_7.text: You ever get bored of standing in this alley?

AD_GuardGossip_14.speaker: Skeeve Stabwell
AD_GuardGossip_14.text: Oh no. I love it. It fills me with purpose.

AD_GuardGossip_1.speaker: Terse Torvalt
AD_GuardGossip_1.text: Nah, it's great getting paid to do nothing but scratch my arse. Dream job, this is.
AD_GuardGossip_1.context: NodeContext: Slightly louder, calling down from the roof.

AD_GuardGossip_10.speaker: Terse Torvalt
AD_GuardGossip_10.text:
'When I was lad I made merry, made merry
With a beautiful lass from the plains...'
AD_GuardGossip_10.context: NodeContext: Singing, slightly drunkenly. Not an existing song so tune can be made up

AD_GuardGossip_5.speaker: Skeeve Stabwell
AD_GuardGossip_5.text: Oh gods, he's at it again.

AD_GuardGossip_8.speaker: Sledge Pettifeet
AD_GuardGossip_8.text: Oi! What have we told you about bloody singing?
AD_GuardGossip_8.context: NodeContext: Calling up to the guard on the roof, telling him off

AD_GuardGossip_12.speaker: Sledge Pettifeet
AD_GuardGossip_12.text: Right. Here's one. Who's pocket would you rather pick - a druid's, or a cleric's?

AD_GuardGossip_13.speaker: Skeeve Stabwell
AD_GuardGossip_13.text: Cleric, any day. Last time I emptied a druid's pockets, all I got for it was a nest of bloody squirrels.

AD_GuardGossip_3.speaker: Terse Torvalt
AD_GuardGossip_3.text: Nah, gotta be druid. Clerics don't carry much gold on 'em. Always offering it to their bloody gods.
AD_GuardGossip_3.context: NodeContext: Slightly louder, calling down from the roof. 'gods' dripping with disdain - thinks this is ridiculous

AD_GuardGossip_4.speaker: Sledge Pettifeet
AD_GuardGossip_4.text: You're both wrong. You pick the pocket of whatever mark you're asking. Common sense, that.

AD_DeathReact_Guard001_0.speaker: Don't-Call-Me-Runt
AD_DeathReact_Guard001_0.text: Watch your backs. We've got a sneak-thief hiding in the shadows.
AD_DeathReact_Guard001_0.context: NodeContext: Guarded, looking around for player

AD_DoorOpenedSelf_Tusgront_0.speaker: Tusgront
AD_DoorOpenedSelf_Tusgront_0.text: In you go, before I change my mind.
AD_DoorOpenedSelf_Tusgront_0.context: NodeContext: Just unlocked a door for player, gesturing them inside

AD_MugOnLeaving_Tusgront_0.speaker: Tusgront
AD_MugOnLeaving_Tusgront_0.text: Said you could pass without paying. Didn't say you could leave!
AD_MugOnLeaving_Tusgront_0.context: NodeContext: With a smile - about to have some fun

AD_DeathReact_Guard003_1.speaker: Skeeve Stabwell
AD_DeathReact_Guard003_1.text: Be ready. Whoever did this is lurking nearby.
AD_DeathReact_Guard003_1.context: NodeContext: Guarded, watching out for player who is hiding nearby

AD_HostileTrespass_Tusgront_0.speaker: Tusgront
AD_HostileTrespass_Tusgront_0.context: NodeContext: Calling on his guards to attack because the player was spotted trespassing.

AD_DeathReact_Guard000_0.speaker: Sledge Pettifeet
AD_DeathReact_Guard000_0.text: Whoever did this is gonna get all nine bloody Hells from me.

AD_DeathReact_Guard000_1.speaker: Sledge Pettifeet
AD_DeathReact_Guard000_1.text: You ain't walking away from this.

AD_StoleRing_Tusgront_0.speaker: Tusgront
AD_StoleRing_Tusgront_0.text: Oi! Someone's taking my sigil ring. You see anyone, you bloody well stab 'em.
AD_StoleRing_Tusgront_0.context: NodeContext: Angered, he's been mugged and the culprit must be nearby

AD_TusgrontIdles_0.speaker: Tusgront
AD_TusgrontIdles_0.text: Might amble over to the Elfsong later. Alan didn't mean 'barred' barred.

AD_TusgrontIdles_1.speaker: Tusgront
AD_TusgrontIdles_1.text: Wonder if the boss will let me cut the shift. Nothing to guard down there anyway, with everyone hidin' out.

AD_TusgrontIdles_2.speaker: Tusgront
AD_TusgrontIdles_2.text: Oh, come on. Anything for a bit of action.

AD_TusgrontIdles_3.speaker: Tusgront
AD_TusgrontIdles_3.text: Don't know what I'm to do if those Watchers amble down. At least I can bribe the Flaming Fist...

AD_DeathReact_Guard002_0.speaker: Terse Torvalt
AD_DeathReact_Guard002_0.context: NodeContext: Guard has spotted player, attacking

AD_DeathReact_Guard002_1.speaker: Terse Torvalt
AD_DeathReact_Guard002_1.text: Eyes peeled. Someone's sharpening a blade for us.
AD_DeathReact_Guard002_1.context: NodeContext: Guarded, looking around for player
